name: Crop and livestock production
description: Within Agriculture, this field involves the study of growing, maintaining, and harvesting crops and pastures, as well as grazing and managing animals. It includes farm management and the production of unprocessed plant and animal products, along with soil fertility and irrigation techniques.

name: Agricultural sciences
description: The broad scientific study of agriculture, including aspects of crop and livestock production.

name: Agronomy and crop science
description: The science and technology of producing and using plants for food, fuel, fiber, and land reclamation, a key part of Crop and livestock production.

name: Animal husbandry
description: The branch of agriculture concerned with the care, breeding, and management of livestock, central to Crop and livestock production.

name: Crop growing
description: The cultivation of plants for food, feed, fiber, or other uses, a fundamental aspect of Crop and livestock production.

name: Dog breeding
description: The practice of mating selected dogs with the intent to maintain or produce specific qualities and characteristics, a specialized area within animal management under Crop and livestock production.

name: Farm and ranch management
description: The organization and operation of farms and ranches for profit, including decision-making on crop and livestock production.

name: Farming
description: The general activity of growing crops and raising livestock, the core of Crop and livestock production.

name: Fruit growing
description: The cultivation of fruit crops, a specialization within Crop and livestock production.

name: Grain growing
description: The cultivation of cereal grains like wheat, rice, and corn, a major component of Crop and livestock production.

name: Horse breeding
description: The practice of mating selected horses to produce offspring with desired traits, part of animal management in Crop and livestock production.

name: Pig farming
description: The raising of pigs for meat production, a segment of Crop and livestock production.

name: Poultry husbandry
description: The raising of domesticated birds such as chickens, turkeys, ducks, and geese for meat or eggs, part of Crop and livestock production.

name: Rice farming
description: The cultivation of rice, a staple grain crop, within Crop and livestock production.

name: Rye and wheat growing
description: The cultivation of rye and wheat, important cereal crops, as part of Crop and livestock production.

name: Sheep farming
description: The raising of sheep for wool, meat, or milk, a sector of Crop and livestock production.

name: Soil science
description: The study of soil as a natural resource on the surface of the Earth including soil formation, classification and mapping; physical, chemical, biological, and fertility properties of soils; and these properties in relation to the use and management of soils, crucial for Crop and livestock production.

name: Sugar cane growing
description: The cultivation of sugar cane for sugar production, a specialized crop in Crop and livestock production.

name: Vegetable planting
description: The cultivation of vegetable crops, a significant part of Crop and livestock production.

name: Wine growing
description: Also known as viticulture, this is the cultivation and harvesting of grapes, especially for wine production, included in Crop and livestock production.
